intro: Porana spectabilis, commonly known as the showy porana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, large, and showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in humid, shady environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and can grow up to 15 cm in length, adding to the plant's visual appeal.
